File.Name: 10.1093_molbev_msae128.pdf
method_of_estimating_gf: minor allele frequency, Watterson's theta, pairwise Fst
raw_stats_gf: (In doc) Lines represent predicted FST values based on nonlinear regression (FST = ab1/âˆ‚t) as used in Bergland et al. (2014) with 95% confidence intervals in gray. The line for the more isolated ponds (top 50% isolated) is lower than for the less isolated ponds (bottom 50% isolated), indicating less pronounced changes in observed allele frequencies, possibly due to lower local âˆ’ âˆ’ âˆ’ gene flow. In contrast to the overall pattern of a decline of median MAF over time, this median increased in some of the subpopulations over time, alongside with rapid and strong genomic differentiation and an increase in the number of heterozygous sites. We interpret these observations as gene flow plus hybrid vigor events.
